title: Kevin Hart's Wife Breaks Her Silence On His Condition, 'He's Going to Be Just Fine'
text:
Kevin Hart's wife just gave an update on her husbands condition, and as we reported, he is recovering from surgery and going to be just fine.

Eniko Hart spoke to photographers Monday morning as she left an L.A. hospital, and reassured them and his fans, "He's great. He's going to be just fine."

The accident has been tough on the comedian's family, but his wife has been a rock for the star and revealed that he is, "in good spirits."

Eniko left the hospital for a quick Starbucks run before returning back to be by her husband's side.

The Blast broke the story, Kevin underwent successful back surgery to stabilize injuries sustained following his early morning car wreck.

Sources close to Hart tell The Blast, "the surgery went smoothly, and he is doing ok."

Our sources say Hart is also up and talking with people.

We're told the comedian is "feeling as good is to be expected right after surgery," and is expected to make a full recovery.

Our sources want it to be clear Hart's back injury did not affect his spinal cord, and that the comedian was able to "walk and move his extremities."

As we reported, Kevin's Plymouth 'Cuda overturned and he had to be rescued by the fire department. Two other passengers were in the car, including his wife's personal trainer and her fiancé.

According to the CHP, Rebecca Broxterman suffered minor injuries, but the male in the car suffered back injuries and was airlifted to a local hospital. .

Kevin is scheduled to remain in the hospital until fully recovered from his injuries and the procedure.
